content: >http://en.rian.ru/world/20090421/121220658.html The glorious homeland of Borat has withdrawn from planned NATO exercises 'Cooperative Longbow/Cooperative Lancer 2009', slated for next month in gallant li'l Georgia. Apparently there was an 'open' invitation to NATO, (sending 19 reps) and to anybody else, including the evil Rooskie, interested in 'interoperability' in defence of a whole bunch of good stuff. The exercise focussing on command and staff will involve 1300 virtually-unarmed troops, probably a half-dozen logistics and field kitchen units. Sounds like the makings of a series of damn fine pot luck suppers. Nutella for everybody! The Russ are saying it's a 'prop job' for the beleaguered Sarkaashvili.
reply: >http://en.rian.ru/world/20090421/121220658.html The glorious homeland of Borat has withdrawn from planned NATO exercises 'Cooperative Longbow/Cooperative Lancer 2009', slated for next month in gallant li'l Georgia. Apparently there was an 'open' invitation to NATO, (sending 19 reps) and to anybody else, including the evil Rooskie, interested in 'interoperability' in defence of a whole bunch of good stuff. The exercise focussing on command and staff will involve 1300 virtually-unarmed troops, probably a half-dozen logistics and field kitchen units. Sounds like the makings of a series of damn fine pot luck suppers. Nutella for everybody! The Russ are saying it's a 'prop job' for the beleaguered Sarkaashvili.
title: Another Walkout

content: quote: Originally posted by popsiq: >http://en.rian.ru/world/20090421/121220658.html The glorious homeland of Borat has withdrawn from planned NATO exercises 'Cooperative Longbow/Cooperative Lancer 2009', slated for next month in gallant li'l Georgia. Apparently there was an 'open' invitation to NATO, (sending 19 reps) and to anybody else, including the evil Rooskie, interested in 'interoperability' in defence of a whole bunch of good stuff. The exercise focussing on command and staff will involve 1300 virtually-unarmed troops, probably a half-dozen logistics and field kitchen units. Sounds like the makings of a series of damn fine pot luck suppers. Nutella for everybody! The Russ are saying it's a 'prop job' for the beleaguered Sarkaashvili. Their actual response was quite comical, “No we will not take part! We’re too busy”! Also, Russia said it will not attend the upcoming NATO meeting in protest! And yes, it’s a prop job! "None are more hopelessly enslaved than those who falsely believe they are free." -Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Sounds like the makings of a series of damn fine pot luck suppers. Nutella for everybody! The Russ are saying it's a 'prop job' for the beleaguered Sarkaashvili.

title: Another Walkout
